Position.general:
```CSS
Position is not a statistically significant indicator of performance [STAT credit refunded]
Note that if the team makeup fails to reach the appropriate number of athletes in each position, the team performance will be considerably lower.
```
Position.specific:
```CSS
Position is not a statistically significant indicator of performance [STAT credit refunded]
Note that if the team makeup fails to reach the appropriate number of athletes in each position, the team performance will be considerably lower.
```

salary.general:
```CSS
Salary is generally correlated with total athlete performance - but there exists plenty of athletes that are overvalued or undervalued..
```
salary.specific:
```CSS
There is no more to know about salary and its relationship with performance [STAT credit refunded].
```

Popularity.general:
```CSS
Popularity appears to have a small relationship with performance.  It also appears that athletes will bring in a certain amount of cash throughout the season as a direct result of their inherent popularity. Disliked athletes generate 2z; unknown athletes generate 0z, Popular athletes generate 1z; and Superstar athletes generate 3z.```
Popularity.specific:
```CSS
Disliked athletes = +0 performance, Unknown athletes = -1 performance; Popular athletes = -2; Superstar athletes = -3 performance.
[(Un)Intended Consequences]
Embracing marketing tactics reminiscent of professional wrestling would increase the performance of ''Disliked'' and ''Superstar'' athletes by +4. ```

Favorite Team.general:
```CSS
It appears if an athlete works for their favorite team, they perform better! It also appears that if the athlete works for a team in the same division as their favorite team, they also perform better!```
Favorite Team.specific:
```CSS
Athletes performing for their favorite team have +3 performance. Athletes working in the same division as their favorite team but not for their favorite team itself receive +2 performance.
[(Un)Intended Consequences]
Increasing the amount of the vacation time of athletes would increase the bonuses outlined by x2.```

Personality.general:
```CSS
Personalities are not inherently linked to performance, but team composition of personalities may impact total team performance. Talk to the general manager for more info[STAT credit refunded]```
Personality.specific:
```CSS
Personalities are not inherently linked to performance, but team composition of personalities may impact total team performance. Talk to the general manager for more info[STAT credit refunded]```

playstyle.general:
```CSS
Playstyles are not inherently linked to performance, but team composition of playstyles may impact total team performance. Talk to the general manager for more info. [STAT credit refunded]
```
playstyle.specific:
```CSS
Playstyles are not inherently linked to performance, but team composition of playstyles may impact total team performance. Talk to the general manager for more info. [STAT credit refunded]
```

Buff-NESS.general:
```CSS
Buff athletes perform better than Swole athletes which in turn perform better than Hella Swole```
Buff-NESS.specific:
```CSS
Buff athletes receive +1 performance, Swole athletes receive -1 performance, Hella Swole athletes receive -4 performance.
[(Un)Intended Consequences]
Reprimanding ''Jackhammer Joan'' for her ''unsportsmanlike'' conduct in her ''ruthless triple-axel-triple-strike'' last season would discourage others from attempting such a feat. It would also change the performance bonus of Hella Swole athletes from -4 to -7. ```

Joint Shear Strength.general:
```CSS
Joint Shear Strength correlates to higher athlete performance.```
Joint Shear Strength.specific:
```CSS
Athletes with Joint Sheer Strength of 3000 psi have +3 performance relative to those with 1400 psi.
[(Un)Intended Consequences]
Instituting ''speed limits'' on ''cybernetically-assisted joint movement implants'' would decrease the relationship between Joint Shear Stress and athlete performance by two-thirds (from +3 to +1)``````fix
Sabersolver inputs
m: 0.001875
b: -2.625
```

Tibia Diameter.general:
```CSS
Thicker Tibias correlate to slightly lower athlete performance.```
Tibia Diameter.specific:
```CSS
Athletes with Tibias of 5 cm have -2 performance relative to athletes with tibias of 1.3 cm.
[(Un)Intended Consequences]
- Forbidding the ''Flying Y'' Formation would reserve the relationship between Tibia Diameter and performance.  In other words, thicker tibia diameters would denote greater athlete performance.``````fix
Sabersolver inputs
m: 0.540541
b: -0.7027
```

Water Reserve Capacity.general:
```CSS
Higher Water Reserve Capacity positively correlates to higher athlete performance.```
Water Reserve Capacity.specific:
```CSS
Athletes with Water Reserve Capacity of 9,750 moles have +4 athlete performance relative to athletes with 3,250 moles.
[(Un)Intended Consequences]
Adopting the World Government's recommended ''HYDRATION MANDATION'' in the official League health guidelines would increase this bonus by 50%. In other words, the athlete with a water reserve capacity of 9,750 moles would receive +6 performance relative to those athletes with 3,250 moles.``````fix
Sabersolver inputs
m: 0.000615
b: -2
```

%Robot.general:
```CSS
The degree to which athletes can have cybernetic implants incorporated into their body ranges from 0% to 40% (League maximum). High %Robot stat is significantly coordinated with higher performance in athletes.```
%Robot.specific:
```CSS
Athletes with 40% %Robot stat have +9 performance relative to athletes with 0% %Robot stat.
[(Un)Intended Consequences]
Instituting  ''speed limits'' on ''cybernetically-assisted joint movement implants'' would halve the bonus granted to %Robots.```

Dietary Doctrine.general:
```CSS
Non-doctrinal, Vegan, and High-fiber diets appear to give athletes higher performance.  The other diets do not appear to indicate broader athlete performance.```
Dietary Doctrine.specific:
```CSS
Non-doctrinal and Vegan diets grant +2 performance. High-fiber diets grant a +5 performance. The other diets do not appear to indicate broader athlete performance.
[(Un)Intended Consequences]
Adopting the World Government's recommended "HYDRATION MANDATION" in the official League health guidelines would grant a +5 performance bonus to athletes with BUFF-Ness Meal Replacement Shake diets and a -5 bonus to non-doctrinal diets (i.e. the non-doctrinal athlete performance bonus would change from +2 to [-3]).```

Doctors Notes.general:
```CSS
Doctor's notes that contain the following terms denote a positive bonus to athlete performance:
> adaptive
> evolutionary
> agents
> non-toxic
> fatty-acid
> peanut

Doctor's notes that contain the following terms denote a negative penalty to athlete performance:
> homologues
> tripex
> neurotrophins
>exhaustive```
Doctors Notes.specific:
```CSS
Here are the terms listed with their effects on athlete performance in parentheses:
>adaptive (+4)
> evolutionary (+3)
> agents (+2)
> non-toxic (+2)
> fatty-acid (+3)
> peanut (+1)
> homologues [-2]
> triplex [-2]
> neurotrophins [-2]
> exhaustive [-4]

[(Un)Intended Consequences]
 If performance enhancing cigars are officially banned from the league, players whose doctors' notes contain "non-toxic" and "agents" denote -2 performance, and those with "homologues" and "triplex" will denote +2 performance. ```

HUD Software.general:
```CSS
Which software package and version used by the athlete appears to affect the performance. Some versions of "Raspberry Pi" and "Ubuntu" denote positive athlete performance.  Some "Apple HUD Maneuver+" versions denote negative performance. There is no effect on performance from having a "Windows Coremove 8000" HUD.```
HUD Software.specific:
```CSS
"Ubuntu" versions 12.0.0 - 18.11.34 grant a +3-performance bonus. "Raspberry Pi" versions 11.0.0 - 16.11.34 grant a +4-performance bonus.  All versions of "Windows Coremove 8000" denote +0 bonus. "Apple HUD Maneuver+" versions 3.8.11 - 12.11.34 grant a -3 performance.

[(Un)Intended Consequences]
Forbidding the "Flying Y" Formation would make Windows Coremove 8000 versions 11.1.1 to 14.50.6 grant a +3 performance.
```

AB Margins.general:
```CSS
Higher AB Margins stat appears to denote higher athlete performance.```
AB Margins.specific:
```CSS
An AB Margin of 8.0 results in a +4 performance relative to an athlete with an AB margin of 0.1.

[(Un)Intended Consequences]
Reprimanding "Jackhammer Joan" for her "unsportsmanlike" conduct in her "ruthless triple-axel-triple-strike" last season would discourage others from attempting such a feat. It would also double the relationship between AB Margins and athlete performance.``````fix
Sabersolver inputs
m: 0.506329
b: -0.05063```

XBH.general:
```CSS
Higher XBH appears to correlate with higher athlete performance```
XBH.specific:
```CSS
An XBH rating of 1.530 correlates to a +5 performance relative to an athlete with a XBH rating of 1.42.

[(Un)Intended Consequences]- Shortening the triple score zone will decrease the relationship between XBH and performance by 80%. In other words, an XBH rating of 1.53 would only denote +1 better performance relative to an athlete with a 1.420 XBH rating.
``````fix
Sabersolver inputs
m: 45.45455
b: -64.5455```

BB.general:
```CSS
BB can be "Upper", "Upper-middle", and "Middle".  An "Upper" BB stat is better than "Upper-Middle", which is better than "Middle".
```
BB.specific:
```CSS
An "Upper" BB stat grants +4 performance; an "Upper-Middle" BB stat grants +3 performance; a "Middle" BB stat grants +1 athlete performance.

[(Un)Intended Consequences]
Increasing the maximum time spans of time outs would make "Middle" BBs receive a +4 bonus instead of a +1 bonus.```

Tackles.general:
```CSS
Higher tackles appear to denote higher athlete performance```
Tackles.specific:
```CSS
An athlete with 750 tackles has +3 performance relative to an athlete with 200 tackles.

[(Un)Intended Consequences]Forbidding the "Flying Y" Formation would nullify the relationship between tackles and performance.
``````fix
Sabersolver inputs
m: 0.005455
b: -1.09091```

Angle of Attack.general:
```CSS
A higher angle of attack appears to denote higher athlete performance```
Angle of Attack.specific:
```CSS
An athlete with an angle of attack of 89 degrees has a +5 performance relative to an athlete with an angle of attack of 1.

[(Un)Intended Consequences]
Reprogramming the AI refs to identify and penalize "dirty tackles" would denote a -4 performance penalty to athletes with "angle of attack" < 20 degrees and >70 degrees.``````fix
Sabersolver inputs
m: 0.056818
b: -0.05682```

Reception.general:
```CSS
Higher Reception frequency seems to denote lower athlete performance```
Reception.specific:
```CSS
An athlete with a reception of 90,000 kilohertz has -3 performance relative to an athlete with 2,000 kilohertz.

[(Un)Intended Consequences]
If performance enhancing cigars are officially banned from the league, the relationship between reception and performance is doubled. In other words, An athlete with a reception of 90,000 kHz will have -6 performance relative to athletes with 2,000 kHz reception.``````fix
Sabersolver inputs
m: -0.00003409090909
b: 0.068182```

Interpersonal Skills.general:
```CSS
Extreme ('Severe') Interpersonal skills appear to denote higher athlete performance relative to athletes with more mild interpersonal skills.```
Interpersonal Skills.specific:
```CSS
"Severely Lacking" and "Severely Inspiring" athletes have a +5 bonus; "Lacking" and "Inspiring" athletes have a +2 bonus; "modest" athletes receive a +0 performance bonus.

[(Un)Intended Consequences]
Embracing marketing tactics reminiscent of professional wrestling would decrease the performance bonus granted to athletes with "Severely Lacking" interpersonal skills by 5 (from +5 to +0) and "Lacking" by 2 (from +2 to +0).```

Performance-enhancing Cigars.general:
```CSS
It appears the Jakarta folks have developed some sort of "performance enhancing cigars". When obtained from JTM, your team will receive a marginal (i.e. very small) increase to total performance. Note. Performance enhancing cigars have no (un)intended consequences.
.Narrative. .Note.
Lung cancer was cured in 3046 but nicotine and cigars remain addictive.```
Performance-enhancing Cigars.specific:
```CSS
Performance Enhancing Cigars denote +1 to total team performance.
```
